column1: The '''W.P. Ker lecture''' was a yearly lecture at the University of Glasgow. It is now a full lectureship. It was instated in 1938 in honour of William Paton Ker
column2: of whom [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] spoke with reverence in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics]]''.

column3: Tolkien was given the honour of providing this lecture. It was a discussion of ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]]'' and the religious themes temptation
